title: Multiple Interfaces
description:
Create:
1. Interface Drivable with method: void drive()
2. Interface Refuelable with method: void refuel()
3. Class Car implementing BOTH interfaces
   - drive() should return "Driving car"
   - refuel() should return "Refueling car"
instructions:
Create:
1. Interface Drivable with method: void drive()
2. Interface Refuelable with method: void refuel()
3. Class Car implementing BOTH interfaces
   - drive() should return "Driving car"
   - refuel() should return "Refueling car"

testCases.description:
Car c = new Car();
return c.drive();

Car c = new Car();
return c.refuel();

Drivable d = new Car();
return d.drive();

Refuelable r = new Car();
return r.refuel();

hints.text: Define a function using the java syntax. Don't forget the return statement if needed.
If stuck, try writing out the solution in plain English first, then convert to java code.
